page.title: 06 Otley Hall 1674-1985
page.content: The Rebow family, merchants, Recorders and M Ps of Wivenhoe Hall and Colchester bought the Hall and traditionally felled the oaks. They may also have caused part of the hall to have been pulled down. However, they did not live there. For 200 years they had tenants who were more concerned with farming than maintaining the large building. Just before the Great war it was sold to Mr Arthur Sherston who repaired and restored it. The Hall became the centre of village fetes and festivities in the peaceful 20s and 30s. Since 1950 Sir Peter Foster, the McAlpines and now, Mr John Mosesson have owned and cared for the Hall. Today it is open to the public and is a truly marvellous local landmark.
